title: Is it correct to say the entire members of the club misses u? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Ask yoursef - who misses you? The answer is “the members” - so it’s plural. And the word “entire” is not in it’s proper place. Plus, I know it’s popular, but it is strongly discouraged to use “u” instad of “you”. You should say “the members of the entire club miss you” or “all the members of the club miss you”. Or, if you want to leave your sentence as intact as possible. “The entire membership of the club misses you.”

You mean the “entire membership” ; the entire members are the members who have not been decapitated, amputated, castrated, &c. Using “u” in place of “you” is extremely informal, and probably disrespectful. “The entire club membership misses you.”
